page.description: If you look at an Alpha Anywhere database through Windows Explorer, you will see that there are many files that begin with each table's or set's name, but have different file extensions. The following table provides a cross reference to lists of functions and methods relevant to each file type.

case.title: .ADB
case.description: Contains the filenames of all tables and sets that are members of the database and the names of all libraries that have been attached to the database.

case.title: .ALB
case.description: The data dictionary for an .ADB file. Contains settings, pointers to all scripts, user defined functions, menus, toolbars, bitmaps, and import definitions that have been defined for the database.

case.title: References
case.description: Storing Scripts in a Library, Attaching a Library to the Current Database

case.title: .ASI
case.description: This file stores web application variables.

case.title: References
case.description: Storing Scripts in a Library, Attaching a Library to the Current Database

case.title: .ALM
case.description: Stores all scripts, user defined functions, menus, toolbars, bitmaps, and import definitions used by more than one table.

case.title: References
case.description: Storing Scripts in a Library, Attaching a Library to the Current Database

case.title: .ALX
case.description: Alpha Anywhere uses the .ALX file to find a specific script, function, operation, setting, etc. that is stored in the data dictionary.

case.title: References
case.description: Storing Scripts in a Library, Attaching a Library to the Current Database

case.title: .ASX
case.description: A temporary file containing the indexing information generated by a query against a set. These files may be deleted.

case.title: .ADBLOCK
case.description: A temporary file used to prevent more than one user from refreshing a shadow database at one time.

case.title: References
case.description: Cannot Refresh Database Problem

case.title: .DBF
case.description: Contains the table's data, one or more records, each containing one or more fields, and the definition of the table's structure. System toolbars are stored in a_toolbars_customized.DBF and system menus are stored in a_menus_system.DBF.

case.title: References
case.description: Table Functions and Methods, Record Functions, Field Functions and Methods

case.title: .CDX
case.description: Contains the table index(es). This file is only present if you define index field(s). Alpha Anywhere uses indexes to quickly find records.

case.title: References
case.description: Index Functions and Methods

case.title: .FPT
case.description: Contains memo fields, which are text fields of arbitrary length. This file is only present if you define memo field(s).

case.title: .DDD
case.description: The table's data dictionary, which contains lists of additional table objects such as Layouts (forms, browses, etc.), report designs, saved operations, field rules, and field names longer than 10 characters.

case.title: References
case.description: Dictionary Methods, Reading From and Writing To the Data Dictionary

case.title: .DDM
case.description: Stores additional table objects such as Layouts (forms, browses, etc.), report designs, and saved operations in memo format.

case.title: References
case.description: Dictionary Methods, Reading From and Writing To the Data Dictionary

case.title: .DDX
case.description: Contains the dictionary's index(es). Alpha Anywhere uses the .ddx to find a specific form name or field rule or whatever is needed.

case.title: References
case.description: Dictionary Methods, Reading From and Writing To the Data Dictionary

case.title: .DBP
case.description: Contains the definition for an active-link table? or mapped table.

case.title: References
case.description: Dictionary Methods, Reading From and Writing To the Data Dictionary

case.title: .SET
case.description: The set's data dictionary, which contains lists of additional set objects such as Layouts (forms, browses, etc.), report designs, saved and operations.

case.title: References
case.description: Set Functions and Methods

case.title: .SEM
case.description: Stores additional set objects such as Layouts (forms, browses, etc.), report designs, and saved operations in memo format.

case.title: References
case.description: Set Functions and Methods

case.title: .SEX
case.description: Contains the set's index(es), used to find set components.

case.title: References
case.description: Set Functions and Methods

case.title: .A5W
case.description: An Alpha Anywhere HTML page that may also contain Xbasic and Javascript code and web components. The Application Server interprets the Xbasic and web components into HTML or Javascript and delivers the resulting page to a web browser.

case.title: References
case.description: Web Publishing Reference

case.title: .A5WCMP
case.description: A file that contains the definition of an Alpha Anywhere web component. A5W pages may contain one or more web components.

case.title: References
case.description: Web Publishing Reference

case.title: .WCP_Settings
case.description: Stores Web Project settings specific to a profile.

case.title: .WebPublishHistory
case.description: Stores publishing history information and is used to determine what needs to be published.

case.title: .MPX
case.description: A temporary file containing the indexing information generated by a query against a table. These files may be deleted. Alpha Anywhere should delete them when exiting.
A temporary file containing the indexing information generated by a query against a table. These files may be deleted. Alpha Anywhere should delete them when exiting.

case.title: .AEX
case.description: Compiled library script files.

case.title: .CHM
case.description: Compiled Windows help files.

case.title: .HLP
case.description: Standard Windows help files.

case.title: .LOG
case.description: Error and transaction logging files.

case.title: .BML, .BMT, and .BMX
case.description: Image library files.

case.title: .EXE, .DLL, and .DRV
case.description: Alpha Anywhere program files.

case.title: .MUF
case.description: Alpha Anywhere creates temporary .MUF files to control the number of people who can concurrently open a database. If a user has a 3 user a5 license, then: when person 1 opens the database, the .MUF file with the same name as the .ADB file is created and a count of 1 is recorded in the .MUF file. When person 2 opens, the count in the .MUF file is increased to 2. When person 3 opens, the count in the .MUF file is increased to 3. When person 4 tries to open the count in the .MUF file would exceed the number of licenses, so person 4 gets an error message. When person 3 closes, the count in the .MUF file is reduced to 2 and person 4 could open. When all users close the count in the MUF file is 0 and the .MUF file is deleted by Alpha Anywhere. If a crash occurs the .MUF file may be left on disk, preventing other users from accessing the application. In this case all users should exit Alpha Anywhere and the MUF should be manually deleted.

case.title: .RMUF
case.description: The Alpha Anywhere Runtime keeps track of the number of simultaneous users using a file with a .RMUF extension, which has the same functionality as a .MUF file.
